docs.lead_paragraph: The question of money has driven broad divisions in Prescott, Ariz., that persist even as the first anniversary of a tragedy that killed 19 firefighters draws near.

headline.main: Money Splits a City Still Mourning Its Firefighters
headline.print_headline: Money Splits a City Still Mourning Its Firefighters

docs.abstract: Question of money is driving divisions in Prescott, Ariz, even as city and its residents approach the first anniversary of tragedy that killed 19 firefighters; 12 of 19 families are suing state, its forestry division and the incident commanders in charge when and before deaths occurred, pushing to find out how a seemingly routine assignment could have gone so wrong.
docs.snippet: The question of money has driven broad divisions in Prescott, Ariz., that persist even as the first anniversary of a tragedy that killed 19 firefighters draws near.

docs.lead_paragraph: Advocates cheered when the Supreme Court ruled in Olmstead v. L.C. that people with disabilities should be given options to live outside institutions. Fifteen years later, progress has been made, with every state allocating more funds to home and community care, but results vary widely depending on where patients live.

headline.main: Salesforce Takes Its Cloud Model to Health Care

docs.abstract: Salesforce and Philips are jointly announcing what they call an “open cloud-based, health care platform,” with an initial focus on managing chronic ailments.

docs.lead_paragraph: A three-judge panel deemed the ban unconstitutional in the first ruling on same-sex marriage at the appellate level since the Supreme Court struck down the Defense of Marriage Act in 2013.

headline.main: Appeals Court Rejects Utah’s Ban on Gay Marriage, Prodding Supreme Court
headline.print_headline: Appeals Court Rejects Utah’s Ban on Gay Marriage, Prodding Supreme Court

docs.abstract: Federal appeals court overturns Utah's voter-approved ban on same-sex unions; ruling stands out among recent victories for gay-rights advocates because it explicitly cites constitutional right for same-sex couples to marry; Utah Attorney General Sean Reyes will immediately appeal case to Supreme Court.
docs.snippet: A three-judge panel deemed the ban unconstitutional in the first ruling on same-sex marriage at the appellate level since the Supreme Court struck down the Defense of Marriage Act in 2013.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
